page.title: 12Games in the Playground
page.content:
'At school we play{Armies.}We split the boys to make even sides and then we pretend to be Vietnam troopers and the other boys are Germans. We seek out the enemy and throw Snap-its* at them. ( * Snap-its - small weighted twists of paper with gunpowder,they explode on landing.) Mark Pottle (9)
At school I play{Crocodiles}on the climbing frame. You get as many people as you want to play; then in the middle of the climbing frame is one person -the crocodile. If someone's foot goes off the climbing frame, the crocodile tries to catch hold of it. If he succeeds, that person becomes the crocodile instead.
Katherine Eeles (10)
